info.title: Media Edge API
info.description: The OpenAPI specification for Media Edge API

post.summary: Signals the end of the ad series

playhead.description: The Playhead represents the current playback position within the media content

sessionID.description: The Media Session ID uniquely identifies an instance of a content stream during an individual playback session

qoeDataDetails.description: QoE (Quality of Experience) Data Details capture performance-related metrics and user experience data

droppedFrames.description: The total count of frames dropped during playback

framesPerSecond.description: The current stream frame-rate (in frames per second)

timeToStart.description: Duration (in seconds) between video load and start

timestamp.description: The time when a media event occurred

type.description: Link containing a more detailed description of the error

requestId.description: Id that uniquely identifies a request

name.description: The path to the invalid property

reason.description: The reason why the property is invalid

type.description: Link containing a more detailed description of the error

requestId.description: Id that uniquely identifies a request

post.summary: Signals the start of an ad

playhead.description: The Playhead represents the current playback position within the media content

advertiser.description: The company or brand whose product is featured in the ad

campaignID.description: The ID of the ad campaign

creativeID.description: The ID of the ad creative.

creativeURL.description: The URL of the ad creative

length.description: The length of video ad in seconds

placementID.description: The placement ID of the ad

friendlyName.description: The human readable name of the ad

playerName.description: The name of the player responsible for rendering the ad

siteID.description: The ID of the ad site

podPosition.description: The index of the ad inside the parent ad start, for example, the first ad has index 0 and the second ad has index 1

sessionID.description: The Media Session ID uniquely identifies an instance of a content stream during an individual playback session

post.description: Sent when buffering starts. Note: Because there is no bufferResume event type, it is inferred when you send a play event after bufferStart

index.description: The position (index, integer) of the chapter inside the content

friendlyName.description: The name of the chapter and/or segment

post.description: Use the Ping request during main content playback in cases when content must be sent every 10 seconds, regardless of other API events that have been sent. The first ping event should fire 10 seconds after main content playback has begun.

post.summary: Signals the end of the session
post.description: Notifies the Media Analytics backend to immediately close the session when the user has abandoned their viewing of the content and they are unlikely to return. If you don't send a sessionEnd, an abandoned session will time-out normally (after no events are received for 10 minutes, or when no playhead movement occurs for 30 minutes), and the session is deleted by the backend.

post.summary: Signals the start of a session
post.description: Signals the start of a new session. When the response returns, the "sessionId" must be extracted and sent for all subsequent event calls to the Edge API server

playhead.description: The Playhead represents the current playback position within the media content

adLoad.description: The type of ad loaded as defined by each customer’s internal representation

appVersion.description: The SDK version used by the player

artist.description: The name of the album artist or group performing the music recording or video

rating.description: The rating as defined by TV Parental Guidelines

channel.description: The Content Channel is the distribution channel from where the content was played

originator.description: The name of the content creator

firstAirDate.description: The date when the content first aired on television. Any date format is acceptable, but Adobe recommends: YYYY-MM-DD

streamType.description: The type of the media stream

authorized.description: Confirms whether the user has been authorized via Adobe authentication

hasResume.description: Marks each playback that was resumed after more than 30 minutes of buffer, pause, or stall period

streamFormat.description: The format of the stream (HD, SD)

station.description: The radio station name on which the audio is played

genre.description: The type or grouping of content as defined by the content producer

season.description: The Season Number that the show belongs to

contentType.description: The Broadcast Content Type of the stream delivery

friendlyName.description: The Content Name is the “friendly” (human-readable) name of the content

playerName.description: The name of the content player

author.description: The name of the media author

album.description: The name of the album that the music recording or video belongs to

length.description: The Media Content Length contains the clip length/runtime

dayPart.description: A property that defines the time of the day when the content was broadcast or played

label.description: The name of the record label

mvpd.description: The Multi-channel Video Programming Distributor (MVPD) identifier that was provided via Adobe authentication

feed.description: The type of feed, which can either represent actual feed-related data such as EAST HD or SD, or the source of the feed like a URL

assetID.description: The Asset ID is the unique identifier for the content of the media asset

name.description: The Content ID is a unique identifier of the content

publisher.description: The name of the audio content publisher

firstDigitalDate.description: The date when the content first aired on any digital channel or platform. Any date format is acceptable but Adobe recommends: YYYY-MM-DD

isDownloaded.description: Specifies if this is a previously recorded session

customMetadata.description: Custom data set by the client in the form of key->value pairs

name.description: The name of the custom property

value.description: The value of the custom property

qoeDataDetails.description: QoE (Quality of Experience) Data Details capture performance-related metrics and user experience data

droppedFrames.description: The total count of frames dropped during playback

framesPerSecond.description: The current stream frame-rate (in frames per second)

timeToStart.description: Duration (in seconds) between video load and start

timestamp.description: The time when a media event occurred

requestId.description: Id that uniquely identifies a request

handle.description: The data returned by the backend

sessionId.description: The unique id for the session that must be sent on all the future requests of this session

type.description: Identifies the type of the received payload

type.description: Identifies the type of the received payload

errors.description: The list of errors for the data sent in this request

type.description: Link containing a more detailed description of the error
